title: Drawing, "Studies of Soldiers' Heads", 1862–63
medium: Black chalk on tan paper, lined; verso: charcoal, black and white crayon on tan paper, lined
inscribed: [Verso: Inscribed in charcoal with serveral w's, at to;and again in sky: Redish - white / L[ight] B[lue].]
creditline: Gift of Charles Savage Homer, Jr.
description:
Vertical view showing the heads of four soldiers, with color notation, "Blue", beside head, at center left; and an indistinct letter, at top.  

Verso:  various sketches of (1)a clouded sky, several "W's" inscribed at top; (2)a shore with boulders and vegetation emerging from the water, shown horizontally, with "Redish - white/ L[ight] B[lue]", the places to which are referred to being marked with circles and strokes, respectively, inscribed in the sky.

tombstone.epitaph:
Drawing, "Studies of Soldiers' Heads", 1862–63.
1862–63. Black chalk on tan paper, lined; verso: charcoal, black and white crayon on tan paper, lined. Gift of Charles Savage Homer, Jr.. 1912-12-102.
